qas.question: By what century did researchers see that they could liquefy air?
By what means were scientists able to liquefy air?
What scientist told the French Academy of Sciences that he had found how to liquefy oxygen?
What minor amount of liquid oxygen was produced by early French experimenters?
On what date was oxygen liquefied in a stable form?
What were Pierre Raoul Pictet's professions?
What was liquified in a stable state for the first time on March 22, 1883?
Who liquified oxygen in a stable state on March 22, 1883?
What university were Zygumunt Olszewski and Karol Wroblewski from?

context: By the <a0_0><a0_3>late <a0_1><a0_2><a0_4>19th<a0_4/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/> century<a0_3/> scientists realized that air could be liquefied, and its components isolated, by <a1_0><a1_1><a1_3><a1_4>compressing and cooling<a1_4/><a1_1/><a1_0/> it<a1_3/>. Using a <a1_2>cascade method<a1_2/>, Swiss <b5_0>chemist and physicist<b5_0/> <a2_0><a2_1><a2_4>Raoul <a2_2>Pierre <a2_3>Pictet<a2_4/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> evaporated liquid sulfur dioxide in order to liquefy carbon dioxide, which in turn was evaporated to cool oxygen gas enough to liquefy it. He sent a <b6_0>telegram<b6_0/> on December 22, 1877 to the French Academy of Sciences in Paris announcing his discovery of liquid oxygen. Just two days later, French physicist Louis Paul Cailletet announced his own method of liquefying molecular oxygen. <a3_4>Only <a3_1><a3_2><a3_3>a <a3_0>few drops<a3_4/><a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> of the liquid were produced in either case so no meaningful analysis could be conducted. <b7_0>Oxygen<b7_0/> was liquified in stable state for the first time on <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><a4_4>March 29, 1883<a4_4/><a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/> by Polish scientists from <b9_0>Jagiellonian University<b9_0/>, <b8_0>Zygmunt Wróblewski and Karol Olszewski.
